abstract.p: John J Grogan is named senior partner in charge of Bank of America account at Bozell Group; Peter Gardiner, managing partner and media director at New York office of Bozell, leaves to become executive vice president and director for media services at Deutsch Inc (S)

block.p: One executive is joining the Bozell Group as another leaves.

John J. Grogan was named senior partner in charge of the Bank of America account, which is handled by the New York office of Bozell and a sibling agency, Temerlin McClain in Irving, Tex. Mr. Grogan, 54, joins Bozell from Advo in Windsor, Conn., where he had been vice president for strategic business development.

John J. Grogan was named senior partner in charge of the Bank of America account, which is handled by the New York office of Bozell and a sibling agency, Temerlin McClain in Irving, Tex. Mr. Grogan, 54, joins Bozell from Advo in Windsor, Conn., where he had been vice president for strategic business development.

In overseeing the Bank of America assignment, Mr. Grogan, who will be based in New York, succeeds Malcolm Mace, 56, who became executive vice president and account director at Temerlin McClain on accounts like Nortel Networks and Nationwide Insurance.
And Peter Gardiner, managing partner and media director at the New York office of Bozell, is leaving to become executive vice president and director for media services at Deutsch Inc. in New York.

Mr. Gardiner, 43, succeeds Steve Soldano, who left Deutsch in April to join the American operation of Optimedia International as president and chief operating officer in New York; Optimedia is part of Publicis S.A.
Bozell and Temerlin McClain are both part of True North Communications.
